headline: Should Eversource's (ES) Increased Wind Project Liabilities Prompt Investors to Reassess Near-Term Profit Outlook?
summary: Earlier this week, Eversource Energy announced a substantial increase of about US$285 million in its liability related to expected future payments to Global Infrastructure Partners, following the 2024 sale of the South Fork Wind and Revolution Wind offshore wind projects; this will result in an estimated US$75 million after-tax non-recurring charge in the third quarter of 2025 and a narrowing of its 2025 full-year non-GAAP earnings guidance due to updated cost projections and project...
